text: The service is good but it takes a longer wait for the food to arrive because they're freshly preparing it as you order it, so I guess it's not suitable for large groups. Not suitable for those with little kids who need high chairs either because they don't have any.

The only reason why I gave 2 stars versus one, was because the pastries were actually good. They bake everything fresh. 

I ordered a cafe macchiato and the "barista" rolled their eyes and the server smirked. Apparently preparing coffees that they have advertised is an annoying task. 

I ordered an omelette and my husband ordered the breakfast sandwich. The cheese in my omelette was not melted and they forgot the eggs on my husbands sandwich. 

I give this place less than a year.

So I went back to and tried the chicken line sandwich with fries. The chicken was moist and thoroughly cooked. The fries were good and tried a sample grape macaroon.
 I definitely want to try one of the chocolate mousse.

The staff here are professional while maintaining a kind and cheery attitude. The man who (I'm assuming is the owner) personally spoke to us and asked as what we were in the mood for and showed us a bunch of recommendations and even swayed my decision. The peach almond pastry I had was superb and the people I was with loved the Honey Burger and the Pecan pastry was equally as awesome.
This place is #bomb.  Food was amazing.  Service is great. French macarons and gelato ice cream hit the spot.  Muy Ono! Definitely coming back.

I have to admit, I was pretty disappointed with my burger. It was an "avocado burger" that... if there WAS any avocado in there, I sure as heck didn't find it. I asked for medium rare and got WELL well done. Like, burnt-to-a-crisp well done. My husband was disappointed in his meal for other reasons. It would have been a total bust if not for those desserts. Oh my god. I've never had such wonderful desserts in my life. Truly. Sad burger. Mind-blowing desserts.

Delicious and cozy.  We met the owner/chef while going over the menu, he greeted us with a smile and a noticeable sense of pride behind his work.  Try the soups, they are delicious.   Support a local business and you'll not regret it.

My husband and I came here to eat for lunch today.

We ordered the following and ate dessert first.

Fruit tart $4.50 plus tax
The woman at the counter said they were fresh made. This was clearly false because I received it from the case and it was frozen. It is still cold over an hour later.

Chocolate dome $4.50 plus tax
It was okay. Nothing special just a typical $5 dessert item.

Truffle and Tomato Salad $7.95 plus tax
The salad had no truffle anything. No truffle oil or actual truffles. It also was missing Basil. I noticed this immediately and went to the counter. For the salad I was given a refund on the spot. But decided to leave after because I did not want to sit in the restaurant any longer.
Note that their online menu says nothing about truffle. The in store menu however has truffle listed as a main ingredient. 

Honey 1/2 Pound Black Angus Sirloin Burger for $9.95 plus tax
Despite all that happened we took this home in a box. We did not look at it until we got home.
The burger came without cheese, pickles, BBQ Sauce, Mustard or Smoked Bacon. All of these are listed on the menu in store and online as ingredients. We did not ask to have any of these removed so they should have all been included as listed Yet they were not included see photo for reference.. The bun had a puncture in it, we did notice the puncture but did not feel like making a fuss. See photo to see exactly how the burger was served to us.

I love to support small and local business. However I can not support a place that does not give me what they promise on their menu.

Went there tonight to try the place.  The food was really good and there was a lot of it. I love supporting small businesses and the owner was there and came over to talk to us.  Will definitely go back again.
I had their signature breakfast sandwich with sunny side up eggs, it was very flavorful and delicious. Good quality of food.
Very very good!  Nice patio area to each outside on. Food was delicious - we had an order of red velvet pancakes, a croissant breakfast sandwich and their brisket breakfast sandwich. yum

Great cafe with great food.  I originally thought it was only a cake shop, but the cafe serves lunch and dinner as well. The owner is VERY nice and comes out to speak to the guest. The service is warm and welcoming. Food is made with quality products . If I didn't live in LA, I would definitely be a repeat customer.

If i could give 6 stars, i would!

As my husband and his friend build their cars in our garage, i go to Honey Cakes Cafe to get us all breakfast to-go. Even though we looked at the menu online, we neglected to read that breakfast ends at 11:30am. By the time i got to Honey Cakes it was 11:39am and the cashier let me know that breakfast is over. But she checked with the cook anyway to see if he would make my order (which consisted of a little bit of everything), and he said yes!! SCORE! Its not their fault i left the house late and ignored breakfast hours. 

I ordered pancakes, red velvet pancakes, 3 egg omlete with bacon tomatoes spinach & jack cheese, 2 sides of home fries, side of sausage and a latte. $38 - not a problem for me cuz the food is EXCELLENT!!! 

I tipped $10 for great customer service. The cashier and cook made my day

This morning went to Honey Cakes for breakfast. Based on 3 eggs and bacon, this place was a huge disappointment. The portions were large, the counter person was lovely, however that's all we can say good about it. The 3 eggs were supposed to be over medium, but were totally dried out, hard yokes, and burned brown on the bottom. The bacon was mostly fat and barely cooked, with running grease. The potatoes were cubed with some onion, but flavorless, cool, and hard. No tomato juice and orange juice was only available in small pre-packaged bottles. The server could not have been more distant or aloof. Other people seem to have had better luck with other dishes, but we will never return.
First time here. I had read reviews on yelp, so figured i would give this place a try. Got a chocolate macaroon and it was Almost as hard as a rock. Needless to say i won't be back.
Great place to have a nice meal add a little dessert too. My kids love the crepes. I'm a jerk chicken person.

Found this place today just walking by. I'm very glad we went in. Lunch was fantastic (jerk chicken) and we were given a complimentary bowl of potato leek soup which was out of this world. Definitely eat here. This is the kind of small restaurant Las Vegas needs more of.

I liked the look of the place. It had a warm and cozy feel of an Italian cafe. I ordered chocolate chip cookies, oatmeal raisin cookies, and chocolate moose cake. They were all delicious. I went back for dinner the next day and ordered 1/2 jerk chicken that came with green beans, red beans & rice. I also ordered the honey 1/2 pound burger with fries. Both meals were full of flavor. I'm a satisfied customer. Also the lady at cash register was very friendly. I don't remember her name.
Onion rings and the honey burger were amazing. Everything was fresh. The gelato was also fantastic. Don't let the high price scare you, it's worth it.

I really wanted to like this place. It's very close to home and had great reviews. Do NOT come here unless you have a very long time to waste. I waited 40 minutes for the food to come out, and there was ONE order ahead of me. Absolutely slowest cook I have ever seen. 

In addition, I was able to see him cooking and he touched everything in the kitchen and on his body with no gloves and no hand washing. 

These two factors alone offset the decent food to the point that I will not return. 

Another man actually ordered, PAID, waited 30 min and left because it was taking so long.
This place is amazing.  The french frys are great. We will be back for sure.  :) The customer service is great. The employees are so personable. Love it.
I got the crepe was not really good and small portion, omelette was really good and a big portion. However everything was overly priced including drinks.

I've only bought macarons from them, two separate trips. The first time, I got an array of flavors and was excited to try them out. The first one I bit into was stale and I was relieved to find it was the only one. So I moved on and didn't hold a grudge. That was a few months ago and decided to give them another try. Same thing - got a bunch, took them home and found out that this time, ALL of them were stale. Didn't feel like going back because it was just easier to cut my losses (less than 10 bucks I think). If you have a product that isn't selling to the point that every piece of every flavor is stale, then don't sell that product. Or waste out old products without having the customer complain first.

We had to run to this side of town today, August 19, for errands. Not sure where to eat, we popped into this small restaurant. The pastries looked yummy but we were looking for lunch. We decided to stay. My husband and I started out with the home made soup French onion soup. It was yummy. It had a very dark broth but was not salty. Really tasty. On the way out, the chef gave us a sample of the potato leek soup he had just made. Even better. I loved the fact that you could feel the texture of the potatoes in the soup. My husband had a brisket sandwich---it was very tender and tasty. I had their special burger with jalapeno cheese and carmelized onion. I opted out of the bacon and bbq sauce (which was very good as I tried some from the brisket sandwich). Again, very good. They were out of fries so I was offered potato salad or home fries. All I can say is that I hope the next time I am there they are out of fries, again. The home fries were outstanding. Our server was a very pleasant and helpful young man. He kept our drinks filled and was never far away. This is truly a little gem. The chef was very pleasant and can really cook!
Food was INCREDIBLY good.  The service was great as well though we had to sit outside as the cooking made the shop a little smoky.  Will eat here again.

I had a little snack with my kiddo there the other day and we loooove it! Great atmosphere, love the French music playing as well. The young man at the front was very friendly and patient with us. Amazing. My new favorite spot.
Such a cute restaurant! A bit pricey, but really good food and excellent desserts.

I live close by so I've been watching closely to see when this place opened to give it a try. I walked in and I have to admit I was impressed as I was not expecting things like gellato/ice cream, and cupcakes to tempt me on my way in... . I just got off work so I planned to grab a menu on my way home, but I actually decided to have an early dinner.

I ordered to go and got one of their burgers. I was a little skeptical of the price till I realized they were half pound burgers. When I got home I saw the container not only with the massive burger, but it was filled to the brim with fries. Given that other places skimp on sides it was a very pleasant surprise. They were decent fries, nothing to write home about, but a good enough fry to go with a burger. I also got a side of onion rings as well since the price was right, and they were huge! Definitely tasted good, but I almost couldn't fit the food in my mouth! (I have a small mouth...thanks genetics), however even with it not quite fitting well in my mouth, I definitely look forward to trying Honey Cakes again, I had a feeling that their burgers weren't their specialty (or they're still trying to find their groove), and I hope that maybe a quarter/third pound might hit their menu in the future, as honestly a half pound with all the food they offer is too much food even for a fatty like me.

This place doesn't have everything, but has a lot of forays into various areas and plan to bring some of family to try them. My girlfriend loves crepes, My mom likes red velvet pancakes, and my dad could probably be swayed to the jerk chicken. I tried to avoid the desserts as I really didn't want to break my diet so I can't really speak on those.

As far as rating's, they still have a little bit of growing pains. They're brand new (at the time of writing) and it is obvious (As it is with any restaurant) that they are, but it is not their fault in the slightest. The food has generous portions, friendly staff, and I feel that once some of the wrinkles are ironed out it will be a solid addition to my food rotation. That being said, there's no wait on the food being good (I am very happy full after just having eaten there) and a solid 3.5-4 stars :)

P.S. My burger was NOT raw even when I ordered it Medium.

I went for breakfast and had an omelette. This review is just about that one meal. 

This is NOT a destination breakfast place. There was no passion in the food.  It was edible but honestly, the McDonald's breakfast tastes better despite whatever artificial ingredients it may be in it. 

The omelette had no seasoning, the cheese was not melted and the eggs were dry. That may be OK for some people but I wouldn't come here expecting a good breakfast. It is adequate at best. 

The coffee was good but the second cup was cold. 

This is a very clean place and the staff seem eager to please. FYI, the toilet paper is VERY thin and has no perforations. Good luck with that.
My 1st time here and loved it!! I got the signature breakfast sandwich the brisket on the sandwich was delish. And the service was great and friendly. I'll be back.

What a great find!! Had breakfast here and was is great!! Fresh made to order can't go wrong here had the brisket and egg sandwich awesome!!!! But the first thing you see is the awesome fresh baked muffins and desserts had the raspberry muffin just wow!! Do yourself a favor stop and wove it a try!!!

Man, this place is great! Incredible atmosphere, friendly services, prices were great, and the food was great!  I had the jerk chicken wings and the flavor was fantastic.  Although the portions were nice, I found myself wanting more!  I ate outside in a cafe style atmosphere which was perfect!  The place was clean and the staff was very lively.  I can't wait to get back to try something else on the menu! Have my eye on the shrimp!

Today was my first time in the Cafe and I must say it was an amazing experience. I met the owner and all the staff along with some of the staffs family that had walked in. Everyone in the Cafe was extremely friendly and the food was excellent. I can't wait to go back and try breakfast now and have another cup of coffee. I am a huge Starbucks fan but now after having the Columbian coffee there today..... Well.... Sorry Starbucks but this coffee is to die for along with the Spicy Rootbeer Tea

We we're looking for a breakfast place to kill time while waiting our turn at the Decatur DMV. This is a great little order-at-the-counter and they-bring-it-to-your-table place. 

I had the brisket Signature Sandwich. The brisket and egg were cooked perfectly & the honey sauce was a bit BBQ but not overly so. Delicious. The potatoes were a nice crisp yet soft texture with mild seasoning & small chopped onions & green peppers. I'm not usually s potato fan, but these were excellent. My daughter had the French Toast with fresh strawberries & blueberries, very lightly dusted with powdered sugar & cinnamon. She's not a big eater, yet finished her plate & the rest of my potatoes. 

Generous portions, cute atmosphere. They also have gelato & plenty of deserts in cases. Maybe next time we're out this way. Sorry, no pics. Didn't think if it until we had finished.

Stopped in for lunch while waiting for my number to get called by the DMV down the street--turned out to be the best part of my day! I ordered the strawberry crepes and they were so light and fluffy! Will definitely be back soon!!

I found myself looking at a small crowd gathering around the doors of a new cafe this afternoon.  I wandered over to see what was going on and it appears that this is opening weekend for this little business. 

First impression: above average rating.
 
Small and intimate coffee and desert style business. Employees were friendly but quite didn't know the flavors of dessert menu.  One lady said she didn't know and didn't bother to offer and seek out the info I wanted.  Another lady overheard me questioning and walked over and said she "would go find out for me". Kudos to her! As I was in the mood to try some of their macaroons!!

Cleanliness:  

Spotless floors, counters, and work areas.  POS register is modern and techy, which was impressive. Employees appearances were nice, neat, and consistent from one to another. The cooks in the back all had the white chef smock and looked presentable and clean.  

Seating: 

This cafe has indoor/outdoor seating.  Inside can accommodate roughly 15-20 people at tables along the inside wall in the left side. Outdoor umbrella patio tables are located just in front of the entrance which can seat about 30 people. 

Parking and location:

Plenty even 12 disabled parking spaces too!  
This business is located in the Costco shopping center in southeast corner of the shopping center. 

Pricing and menu:

Price seems to be a little on the high side for some of the menu items. A dozen mini macaron cost me $15. They have a full menu serving appetizers, breakfast, lunch & dinner items.  I think I will give their burgers a try next time. Fountain drinks, bottled drinks, coffee, and a gelato station will sum up the rest. They didn't seem to have any menus printed up as of yet, only TV style displays behind the counter. As I stated above, I came in because I wanted something sweet.  I ordered the macaroons and to my delight, I am impressed.  Rich with flavor, vibrant in color, and they have a robustness that will pop on the first bite. 

All in all, I am pleased and am looking forward to coming back for an actual meal. Having said that, I welcome you Honey Cakes to the neighborhood!  Much luck to all of you.
Wasn't very good, fries were cooked and kept warm under a warning light and u could taste they weren't fresh. Waiter forget part of order and just wasn't impressed. I won't go back.
The red velvet pancakes were spongy and had a sour  taste. The breakfast calzpne was mostly dough that was still raw. TERRIBLE!

Everything we had was delicious!  Strawberry crepes were ok, I was not a fan of the bottled fake strawberry sugary syrup dribbled on top but the fresh berries were delicious! They could use a better quality jelly. French toast was typical but the breakfast sandwich coffee and French Macarons were amazing!

Me and my mother-in law and grandma love breakfast days and we are always searching on yelp for places .  We found this spot and we couldn't be more happy we did , when we walked in it was almost empty but empty don't mean a bad thing in this case ,  on display they have all this pastries  that are beautiful and  we cant wait to try them all  . 

I love the fact that they have breakfast all day even if its not showing on the board they do serve breakfast and its just perfect and delicious .  

Everything we had was so fresh and flavorful  , just perfect !

The pastries are delicious and I loved it! A nice place to sit and have a conversation with a friend or Boyfriend. I've been back a couple of times and I've been happy with the service they provide. Thanks Honey Cakes!

This place may be new but they have plenty of clients. While breakfast I got of eggs and potatoes were mediocre, the staff were amazing. You could feel that they wanted to be there. Sandra was the one that took my order at the counter. Besides a few mishaps I got the order I wanted. 

One man there really went the extra mile for me. Their pastry chef Anthony and his team do a beautiful job. When I arrived, Anthony came out with two raspberry tarts. He saw me watching them and offered one to me. Of course I couldn't refuse. The man was very polite and proud of his work, for a good reason. 

The pastries were crafted wonderfully. The lines were smooth and softly elegant. The colors were clear and nicely mixed. Each pastry seemed to reflect its creator. Each showing confidence. 

All wasn't good however. The eggs and potatoes I received were not cooked through. When I looked into the middle of the folds of eggs they were raw. Some of the potatoes were raw. The peppers didn't look nor taste cooked. With the pancakes, I'm sad to say that I was disappointed. It tasted like bisquik. I wouldn't serve it at home I don't like paying for it. For the price, which was decent, I expected better. Now for the coffee, it was unfortunately bitter and not in the good coffee way. Anthony said the coffee was a Brazilian Columbian mix but it didn't seem to have the quality I hoped for. 

The atmosphere was another saving grace besides the staff who were all around friendly. It had soft jazz and french music playing that with the decor transported me to a wonderful place. It had characteristics of a french cafe. The colors were a little bright in places but it wasn't overbearing. Tuning down the hue would make this better if they were going french. 

One other slightly unfortunate mishap was the table. It was remarkable small. It would be great for a small pastry and coffee but once you have breakfast plates, which were huge, it didn't fit. I was worried all the time that the plates would be knocked off. 

While I wouldn't go to Sweetcakes for the breakfast, I would definitely go for the pastries. They were beautiful to look at. An artist truly created them. With a little more smoothing on the fondant it would be perfect.

Total Yelp 5-star find in far NLV. Want lightning fast service and casino Starbucks pastries trucked in from who knows where, then don't come here. This is a small business with big heart. The people who greet you and serve you are the same people who made your food by hand on site with great skill and care. If there is any criticism, it would be trying to do too many great things all at once. But they do them all very well. Brisket for breakfast? Yes! Smoked in back. Fluffy scrambled eggs. 10 types of macarons, all made fresh with almond flour. Gelato dressed for success in the front display case. And as promised, chef Anthony's personal favorite, the butterscotch muffin was off the charts!  Calling all Vegas foodies!!!
Its a shame that it took 40minutes for us to receive our order and we were only 2 groups of 2 in the resto at that time. The food is great but I expecetd more considering it was a 40 minute wait.

I have been to this bakery three times already.  The first time I ordered a crepe, I had to replace a fruit after the order because they realized they had run out- no problem. I ordered the crepe with Nutella and they gave it  to me with a vanilla custard. It was so good anyway, I didn't mind the mistake. They threw in an extra crepe and free fries to make up for the fruit issue. 
Great customer service so far. The fries were really good, the veggie wrap was awesome, the macarons were fine, the Butterscotch muffin was yummy, the strawberry tart  and fruit tartes were amazing! 
My very picky French husband is happy too! 
Overall, good experience, will go again!

Went on Friday night 10/14/16. It was dead; only one couple eating outside and that was it.  We ordered two dinners, the jerk chicken and brisket. After 25 minutes I asked how much longer it would be and was told 5 minutes. After 40 minutes, we decided to let the manager know and asked for our money back. Our food must not have even been close because they did not offer us our meals or say they were almost done. We were excited when we got there for the variety of food offered but very disappointed in our experience.  I don't write reviews often and can't remember ever asking for money back at a restaurant.

First visit to this cafe, off the 215 and Decatur in a large shopping center not too far from Best Buy and near the Aliante Casino. 

The cafe is small, so it would be difficult with larger groups of more than 5 or so. It would be a tight fit, especially after our first visit on a Sunday around 11am. The inside was full of customers so we decided for a lighter meal instead of dining in. There are many tables outside but the wind was pretty bad. 

We ordered: blueberry muffin and raspberry muffin. I really wanted to try an espresso drink but didn't see any previous posts on whether they were good or a drink menu nor did I see anyone other customer with an espresso drink, so I skipped it this time. Both muffins were fluffy and moist with a nice crust on the muffin top. Not sure if I'll return to try the other items.

I loved this little place and been here twice. I went back the 2nd time because the 1st was so great but this time around I decided to never go back. 

I went in and picked up desserts for the family and some breakfast. The omelet comes with 4 items of your choice I asked for tomatoes, onion and 2 bacon...I was charged extra for the 2nd bacon because they called it "extra" although it comes with 4 ingredients of your choice but I didn't argue with her I just paid it. 

The chocolate muffin looked delicious but we couldn't eat it because it was hard as a rock. The entire muffin top was solid, gross. The key lime pie had brush bristles in it, or at least that's what it looked like and we went home with 3 drinks that weren't marked and we couldn't tell which was what from a latte, mocha latte and caramel machiatto. 

I ordered the pigs in a blanket and they forgot to give me syrup. This stuff was all ordered to go. I didn't notice all this until we sat down to eat at home. 

Also, they have a display of assorted macaroons when you walk in, which I was told were on sale since they were assorted and a dozen. Of course they weren't, I paid $1.50 each for 12 macaroons, $18. At regular price, I might as well picked the ones that I want since all the flavors in the assortment were disgusting. 

I'll never go back here. It's an adorable place and the staff is friendly but I cant deal with my food being stale or finding junk in it. I'm disgusted.

I've been here about five times and this is my first review. I have to say that every single time we've been here, the service and food have been fantastic! Every meal is made to order, so you might be waiting for your food. On average, we've waited around 20 minutes for our food, which isn't too bad considering everything has just been made and it's hot and fresh tasting when you get it. Their crepes are one of the most delicious ones I've had, and you can see them being made; their pastries are sinfully yummy as well. The ambiance is very nice, like you're in a little French bistro, It is small and quaint. There's so many pastries to chose from and each one looking more delicious and decadent than the next. I recommend Honey Cakes if you're looking for a relaxed atmosphere and good food. 
This isn't a fast food joint, so if you're a little pressed for time and looking for something to eat, I recommend Express, bc they have everything already made and kept warm. (and only a few steps away)

If you're military, don't forget to ask for 10% off discount!
Great food, customer service is usually a bit slow, great place for desserts. I love the feel of this place.

The potato - leek soup was rich and real, with my Honeyburger was a delight from the top of the toasted sesame-seed bun down through the thick and flavorful beef patty, and the caramelized onions, fresh lettuce and tomato, and jalapeño-jack cheese in between. Jordan's five-star gracious service matches the exceptional quality of the food. The ambience is casual and classy at the same time. Worth a special trip.

Been wanting to try this place, had the opportunity today. Ordered the crepe breakfast.  The poor cashier couldn't even give me my change.She had to dig into her tip jar.  And I had to wait for the next customer for the rest. Cute place though.My crepe itself was tasteless but the filling of eggs, cheese and lots of meat was delish. I had water to drink as they only have flavored teas, their soda fountain was out and the coffee machine broke. Hope this wasn't a typical day.
This place is a hidden gem tucked away in the corner.  They also give a 10% military discount.  If you have not checked this place out yet, you are missing out

I have been here a couple times and I can't say I am a fan of the food but the bakery selection is very good. The oreo cheesecake I recently had was flavorless and was too small for the $4.50 price tag on it. The tiramisu however was spot on delicious. If you like carrot cake see if you can get some because it goes fast. It's some really good carrot cake. The burgers and other sandwiches have been just average or under and too pricey. Inside there isn't much space if it's busy so I'd recommend snagging a table on the patio. If anything at least stop by and pick up some desserts for yourself or as a treat for someone else.

We ate lunch here and it was all delicious!!!! Wonderful friendly service, we had the sirloin burger and Avocado burger they were Delish! Also had the potato salad and onion rings;);)! Oh and don't forget the delicious Macaroons!!

Decided to stop here with the husband and toddler after seeing the yelp reviews. I'm only glad to stop here so I know not to go back. Something is right since the reviews seem to be great but for me it wasn't either the food or service. I ordered the hamburger which was dry & unimpressive. We sat outside on the patio and the ambience was nice, until we were hit up for a "donation" by a passerby. Lots of people in Las Vegas always asking for handouts. Anyways, service was lacking. We had to go to the counter for any drink refills & for our utensils and napkins. The only time they came to our table was to bring the food. It sounds like their breakfast might be better but the menu is lack luster. Maybe we will be back. But only time will tell.

Solamente hay un mesero se tardaron demasiado para entregar la comida yo ordene un croissant sandwich y mi hija una crepe el sandwich estaba bien pero ami hija su orden se la trajieron hasta cundo yo abia terminado de comerpara el tienpo q agaramos la comida el cafe estaba frio muy decepcionada no llevava mis anteojos y no ofrecen un menu de mano solamente por una pantalla

This place was a very nice cafe type restaurant. When my husband and I went in the chef was at the front welcoming people inside. Their gourmet food was very delicious. You can tell the chef put a lot of time into each dish. Their dessert section was displayed very fresh and beautifully. Very friendly service and great food. We will definitely come back.

Great much needed type of cafe in Las Vegas.  Old world charm and great tasting food and deserts.  Had the chicken with Jamaican curry which was very good.  Good selection of deserts.  Nice outdoor seating which is another thing our city needs more of.
Personnel were very friendly.  We all need to support such establishments.

First time in this establishment and I had a strange experience today.  
I didn't stay to try the food so I can't comment on that.  My Mom and I walked in after  a group of 4 who took a table so we grabbed one as well.  The lady behind the counter immediately greeted them and was very gracious, brought them menus, told them about food and completely ignored us.  My mother is elderly and has bad vision so she was having a hard time reading the menu board.  I finally approached a different worker and asked for menus.  She said that they only had 2 menus and that the other employee gave them to the other table.  We were then standing in front of our table and I was helping my Mom with the posted menu when the first employee finally acknowledged our existence by asking me to not leave my purse on the table.  Her words were "we are a family here but someone could take your purse, I would appreciate if you didn't leave your purse on the table".  The purse that I am literally standing in front of? Well then, thank you for the warm welcome!  Maybe she was legitimately trying to be helpful but after ignoring us for 15 minutes it came off very condescending and rude.  We finally got in line and a family ordering was having trouble because they were out of fountain soda and some other items.  We just decided to leave.  There were a lot of pre-made items in the glass counter and they didn't look very appetizing.  Things also seemed a bit over priced for the small sizes I saw.  I'm honestly not sure if I will be back, it was an uncomfortable visit.  Like I said, strange.  The ladies need some fine tuning with their customer service skills and probably more than 2 menus in the whole restaurant.

Always looking for a new place to eat. So took a chance on this place. The inside is clean and was greeted with a smile. Definitely not a big chain restaurant but more than makes up with personality. Small and quant with upscale decor. 
What I enjoyed the most is the freshness of the food. The menu is small but well prepared. Remember it's in the sauce. Another thing is the menu items are not like most traditional restaurants. Nice to taste new flavors. 
Nice variety of deserts. Home made ice creams and dessert you normally only get in high priced restaurants. 

I will definitely come back to try other menu items. 
Prices are fair and well worth the hearty food portions. 

For those of you who rated this place poorly. Shame on you. This place cooks with heart and it shows.

Long wait for food and burger sat up under the heat lamp for about 15 mins. Not sure why. And asked for no BBQ sauce and there it was. 45 mins for food during that time 3 people canceled their orders and left. This is our second time here. Sad it's the only place close to home

Very good service and food. Small location and limited and thorough menu. Breakfast brisket was very good and potatoes were excellent. 
Service was attentive.

Let me start off by saying I will never stop coming here. The food=bomb, ambience=serenity, the scenic views= peaceful. This place is a gem. So many pastries and great breakfast items to choose from it will be a while before I try them all. The coffee and latte selections are tasty. I had the butterscotch muffin and I drooled on myself lol. So good I can't imagine the rest of the pastries. Chef suggested I try the signature sandwich which was beef brisket, eggs, and who cares what else because it was good. Felt life a kid again trying not to dirty myself lol. The price is cheap for the quality your getting. Patio and mountain views are picture prefect. Plenty of parking. Located near Costco so shop the eat as I think of you eat first you will be in a coma lol. Must come here.
Decent food, somewhat bland flavors. We got the breakfast crepe and the veggie wrap & cappuccinos. Mediocre food and service. Probably won't return.

Had the 3 egg breakfast with crispy bacon and homestyle potatoes. The eggs were cooked perfectly and the homestyle potatoes were seasoned perfectly and tasted great. It is a very intimate setting with French bistro decor. Staff was friendly. They have a selection of pastries and even gelato! I recommend if you are looking for a quiet little breakfast place. Oh they have an espresso bar if you need a drink to wash down your pastry.

The staff and owner of this cafe were wonderfully welcoming and accommodating. The food was really good but I think they excel in the bakery and gelato department. I would highly recommend stopping in and sampling what they have to offer.

Me and a co worker ordered a couple of burgers from this place. One well done and one medium well. Both of our burgers were raw.  Took one bite out of the burger and spit it out. When I went to show the manager he said it was medium rare. Don't make up excuses fix the problem. That burger messed up my entire day.
Delicious food.  Great service.  They were out of several desert items I wanted to try so I need to come back soon!  Great little place to eat any time of day.

Had the turkey bacon wrap but instead of turkey there was brisket... So good! Service was really friendly and my food didn't take long at all. And all the desserts look so mouth watering. You seat yourself and if you want a menu you have to ask for it. Not a problem at all. Wide selection of pastries and gelato as well  macaroons are always a plus

Just... Wow! My husband and I had to go to the dmv so we did a search for breakfast places off of Decatur. Found this place and decided to give it a shot.

When you first walk in you are greeted by a dozen Gelato flavors and a gorgeous  display case filled with freshly bakes pastries and other goodies. The breakfast menu ranges from NY steak and eggs to veggie crepes with lots of goodness in between. My husband had the brisket sandwich and it was amazing. The meat was tender and flavorful, not even the slightest bit dry. I had the breakfast crepe with bacon, sausage and ham. Oh. My.  Goodness. It was fantastic!

The owner came out to greet us - a friendly, very conversational guy. We chatted for a bit and discussed the lunch menu, something that we have decided to check out for ourselves in a few hours.

I love supporting small businesses and this is for sure going to be one of our regular breakfast spots from now on.

Had the breakfast crepe and pigs in a blanket. Cooked well. Crepes were light and fluffy, yet didnt fall apart as easily as in cheaply made crepes. A bit too sweet for my taste but the sausage wrapped in red velvet was delicious.

Wait staff was a bit untrained, but as to be expected with.a new place. If you want a physical menu you'll have to ask for it. Otherwise, great breakfast

I'm not impressed at all. The place is nice but not too welcoming. The food is, well, i'd say it looks and taste ok but too pricy for a meal. $15?? it's better to go to dennys or other local cafe joint for the samething. And my girl got a crepe. And this really blow me away. Crepe is supposed to be made fresh from a syrup. Well, they made the crepe like making taco. The crepe is already pre-made and stored in the fridge then re-heated when u order it. I'm not going to blame the workers because they try to please us. I blame the owner for this as this isn't a practice they should imply. I'd rather go to chinatown and get crepe. At least they make it fresh. Overall, not coming back. They're way too pricey, and who knows maybe food is done few days ago and just restock it.

This cafe is pretty cool for a bite. They offer a few cooked to order meals. The pastries were nice and the drink selection was good. The staff was really great and the young man doing most of the work was very polite, attentive and helpful. 

The reason i didnt give 5 starts was the execution of the dishes. The crepe was the thickest crepe i have ever had and the dishes lacked flavor. The potato pieces with the breakfast could have been salted or seasoned but they were not, and plain is fine but dont put my eggs right on top because then I cant add salt to the potatos.

The price was very affordable which is why I left satisfied. If it had cost more I dont think I would be happy. I actually would like to go back and try the french onion soup.

The food here is great! I had the 1/2 lb. "Honey" burger with the onion rings and the burger was the best! Thick, juicy, delicious! Remember the old burger places that hand formed their patty and it was thick and flavorful? You're in for a treat here. The onion rings also seemed hand dipped and spiced well. My daughter ordered the mac and cheese made with Brie and (I believe) cheddar cheese. I had one bite just to try it and WOW! I'm definitely ordering that next trip in! My family and I will be back here as my new favorite. The owner / chef seems very professional but has to work in a very cramped kitchen (poor guy!). Pumpkin pie gelato  was very good, also.

Let me tell you about the service....The young man that served us was genuinely interested in giving us quality service and product. He was on top of refilling our drinks and we were left to want for nothing. 15% - 20% tip recommended if you get him!

Best coffee!  Expresos are delish! To put the cherry on top, the desserts they have here are amazing!   I've also had the pleasure of enjoying sine of the dishes they serve and ley me just say that I have not been disappointed with this place.  On top of that service is always friendly and very welcoming

Just discovered my first Vegas hidden Gem. Wow what an amazing sandwich. I had the 4 meat sandwich and fries with a side of potato salad. Not to over hype but I found my new favorite fries. the sandwich was piled high with succulent goodness and now my tastebuds are excessively happy. Their treats are also fantastic. but I have not had that good of a sandwich in a while. Top Notch in my book.

Just had a terrible experience where they took 40 mins to make our food, rude service, thought his macaroons were house made but just saw in Costco today the very macaroons he sells in his restaurant. He gets them for $16 for 36 macaroons and charges $1.50/ individual macaroon. Terrible service, mediocre food, and lies of food. DON'T eat here ever, the owner is running this place to the ground and refuses to listen to advice to revive his already dying restaurant
Wonderful small bakery cafe with a caring owner and staff.  The quiche and crepes are superb! The owner is a famed chef.  Delicious!!

I had the signature breakfast sandwich which was great! Wonderful brisket on a large roll and great home fries with fresh vegetables in them. The owner provides great customer service and all of the staff were friendly and very attentive to making sure customers were well taken care of.

I've been here multiple times now and they have Great service and even better food. All the staff is real nice. Chef will visit the table and if the meal isn't perfect, they will fix it without making a big deal about it. It's a local business and its small but totally worth the trip!

What a Find!  Honey Cakes is a cozy place in a strip mall that serves excellent food and wonderful deserts.  We had dinner there tonight with a couple of friends and we were pleasantly surprised with every dish that we ordered.  I started with the French Onion Soup and it was fantastic.  The serving was in a saucer type bowl which was a conversation piece in itself.  My next dish was the Chicken Curry and again it was outstanding as well.  There was plenty of Chicken and the curry was very tasteful, but not overpowering.  It was served with white rice, which was great for soaking up the curry gravy and french string beans which were cooked to perfection.  I ended the evening with a small cup of Rum Raisin Gelato which was the best that I have ever tasted.  

I would highly recommend Honey Cakes and we certainly will be dining there more frequently.

Disappointed my truffle salad was suppose to come with heirloom tomatoes and mozzarella cheese, but instead sliced red tomato and Swiss cheese. Sad that they said nothing to me. Only good thing my daughters avocado hamburger was excellent. Dessert was yummy. Will go back but never order salad again waist of money.
Wonderful potato leek soup. Very pleasant service. Everyone was so nice. Cute place, hopefully will do well versus the big chains in the same shopping center. Would definitely visit again.

I read all the great reviews so decided to check it out...bad idea! I found mold on my strawberry tart after I already took a bite, super grossed out . The staff was very nice though. The owner which is also the pastry chef definitely needs to bake daily. Beware!

Love this place there omelets are super moist and juicy there home made fries awsome you will love them

Must try banana nut muffin the best ask for them to warm it up taste fresh
I had a pretty good signature breakfast sandwich. I didn't bring my phone though so I don't have a picture.

Customer service is very good. The two guys over there were very pleasant . Went for butterscotch muffin since the reviews were all so good about it, but sadly i dint get that. Bought the raspberry muffin and blueberry muffin. Both were delicious

2 Stars because it was a Cute set-up and the places looked great and the people taking our order were so friendly. 

I bought 5 Macaroons. Had one bite of each and I was good. I was told the green was pistachio but tasted like chalky dry coconut. The white with sprinkles tasted like pistachio but very very dry. The purple was the better one but still not my thing. Idk maybe Macaroons just aren't my thing? My Husband ate the strawberry red one and said it was great but refused the rest after one bite of the green. I just don't believe these raves about confections are so awful. They have to be cutting corners in the baking process. It shows. 

My chocolate cake.... The reason for a bad review. It was a hard dry brown brick. They must be storing their pastries incorrectly. Fridge maybe? Very very stale and just plain awful! (Insert grossed out emoji here) The frosting was so hard I stuck my fork in it and I could hold the whole cake up. 

Hide your kids, hide your Wife, hide your tastebuds!  Avoid this place D:

My parents wanted to try this new little cafe out based on a recommendation of a friend.  Nice little patio seating,  and as soon as you walk in you are greeted by a beautiful display of pastries and gelato. It's quite cramped as you walk to the back to place your order. Constantly having to move out of the way of waiters walking back and forth with plates that were on their way out...and dirty ones on their way back in. After placing our order of pancakes,  omelets and a bananas fosters crepe we sat ourselves at a tiny table. While waiting, i had full view of the cooking process. Being a stickler for cleanliness,  i immediately noticed a few red flags. The same people taking orders,  bussing tables and cleaning took part  in the plating of some foods. I noticed one employee touch the register,  multiple use utensils,  her hair etc...then handle a few bananas she sliced with her bare hands without washing. She handed them off to the cook, and a plate of premade, cold crepes sat waiting. As a busser brought used, dirty plates back to the food prep area he placed them right next to the crepes. So are we cleaning and storing filthy dishes next to what should be a clean food prep area? So the cook brings the bowl of what should bananas fosters back to the same employee who by now simply placed her hands under a stream of running water for two seconds and called them clean. The cold crepes get a few seconds in the microwave.  She pours them into the crepes n folds them with her bare fingers. She looks at another employee and they stare at the crepes for a few seconds.  She pours out some liquid from the plate and brings them to me. I look at this hideous mess they call bananas fosters. In hind sight i should have taken photos of it to show how sad they looked. They sat in a watery pool of white liquid,  coming undone and looked as if they were just thrown on the plate. No garnishment what so ever to make it look as if someone made an effort with them. I thought, maybe it's a house recipe...so i took a bite. Disgusting!  From the look on the employees faces prior to bringing it out, they knew it wasn't right. But i guess they feel comfortable serving what they know is sub par food. So obviously i had to bring it back. The employees were nice about it, sure they expected it. Since the rest of my table was nearly done with their food i opted for the fresh strawberry crepe which was fast to make. This time it was plated nicely.  The crepe itself was cold, rubbery and bland. They are premade, who knows how far in advance because the are just stacked high with plastic wrap over top. When an order comes in, they just pop it in the microwave.  The rest of my table enjoyed the omelets. Pancakes smelled funny and were not spectacular.  The other pastries that were available looked pretty great,  but since i did not try them i can't rate. So the one star reflects the food practices and the sorry crepe. I can't get over it! It was disgusting!  I guess the nerve of them serving it when they knew it shouldn't have killed it for me.

Not a very good drink selection here but the food was amazing and the service is pretty good. We have been here a few times. Some times they have a wide variety of selections in the desert case and sometimes they don't. Their breakfast is amazing, the potatoes are my favorite. I definitely recommend the red velvet pancakes! Will definitely be returning

Just moved to the area and passed this place while driving around one night. Saw the menu online and wanted to try them out but today I only had time to pick up their desserts. Bought two tarts, almond and peach. Just had mine and it was delish! Menu looked creative but a bit expensive. I'm sure we'll try an actual meal here in the near future.
Food took FOREVER and was not great. The desserts look good, but I wouldn't come here again for food.

Small but great food. The structure of the cafe is so small the server cannot make it through the small galley!!
Their pastries are very delicious and worth the price! Eat outside for a less crowded atmosphere.

I love small hole in the wall foodie joints, unlike your favorite spot, this restaurant has an unwelcoming waitress with an attitude that leaves the guests at an uneasy state and your food tasteless and bitter. 

If you see the disgusted, disgruntled face hidden behind 2,000 lbs of make up, turn around.

On the way to Costco with my daughter we  decided to get something to eat before shopping when we see Honey Cakes. I was excited to try this place that I've reviewed on Yelp before. When we walk in we're greeted by Amy and she was a delight. She asked if this was our first visit and asked if she could give us a tour of this shoppe. Amy offered us a taste of any or all of the gelatos, she walked us through the other displays of wonderful baked goods. I ordered the seafood burger with onion rings, raspberry tea and my daughter order the pesto turkey sandwich w/ fries and a mango tea and a chocolate muffin. Amy brought us the muffin to which she warmed up without us having to ask. With a visit like this I know you would expect 5 stars but Amy left at this point and we were left with the waitress from service hell. Not only did this young woman ignore a waiting customer that left after not being acknowledged after several minutes and several passes from this waitress. Unfortunately I didn't get her name but she was the only other waitress in the place. She brought is our food and continued assisting the only another customer that was in the pIace. I asked for some dressing for the burger I'd ordered but  my daughter had finished her fries and I had eaten mist of my onion rings when about 7-10 mins later she brought me a container of mayo and proceeded to pick something out of the container and flick it away. She handed me the container looking me directly in the eyes and walked away as I saw some dried up food on the container. I began to scrap at the dried food as it began to flake off. At this point I told my daughter what had happened and we got up abd left after we could not locate Amy. I spent $30 for fries onion rings and tea because there was no way at all that I would ask this awful person to correct such a blatant disregard of sanitation and customer service. The 2 stars are for the entire experience but Amy gets 4 stars.

Wow!!!!This place has Horrible  Service Horrible. They had No Shrimp.No avocado.Soda was flat.Oven problems.Food took over an hour.
Then the girl forgets to give me my dessert after I had already paid for it!!!I had to ask her for it after she went to the back and disappeared for 10 mins.Never will I ever go back!!!!
First time stopping in for dessert,  Irish Creme Cheesecake was delicious and the atmosphere is very inviting.
This place was great! Loved the macarons and the entire desert selection in general. Tried a raspberry chocolate truffle cake and mango/coconut macaron. Delicious!!

AWESOME SERVICE!!!! I took my family to this cafe after finding it on restaurants.com. The food was great and the presentation of their desserts was comparable to a high-end restaurant on The Strip! We ended up chatting with the owner, who was very friendly. He, his wife, the cook and the girl behind the counter were all very attentive and it was obvious they each take pride in their business.

You walk in and feel like your in a fancy French cafe. The desserts are awesome. The menu is kinda short and pricy, but the chef prepares each item himself and takes care when doing so. You get what you pay for and its worth it. I'll definitely go there again.

Small bakery/cafe with super friendly service. Great for quick to-go pastries. You order first inside, take a number and take a first come first serve table. 

We sat outside, which is pet friendly :) and ordered a couple breakfast dishes (their breakfast crepe and omelet) and coffee, which never went empty. 

Our food was good but nothing fancy. I think I would have liked a bit more veggies in my build-my-own omelet and ranch potatoes, but can't really complain because it was still good and I didn't come with a huge appetite. I think they are known for their red velvet pancakes though (which I'll have to try next time). 

The servers and other staff are very friendly and attentive. Our drinks and coffee never went empty, and we never had to wait too long for anything.

I got one of their raspberry muffins to-go and sooooo glad I did! It was the best muffin I've ever had! Not too sweet, buttery but not messy, moist, flavorful... I really loved the top of the muffin (which is always the best part, right?). It was a little crispier cookie-like, dusted with powder sugar, and a little sweeter, butterier. Another great thing is that their muffins are HUGE!

I will definitely be back!!!

This is a new place located in the North Part of the valley.  The menu is simple and easy to read and by the looks of it they serve breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The majority of the items were sandwiches and burgers but they also have little breakfast quiche that looked delicious.  I was able to try a sample of the brisket which I am always a fan of but this was slightly different than what I am used to. I enjoy a Texas style brisket with lots of smoke and a flavorful rub.  This had none of that but was still tender and tasty.  I decided to have the burger and o-rings which was alright.  

What were more exciting to look at were the desserts and the gelato.  The Red Velvet pastry looked amazing among all of the other delicious choices.  It looks as if the pastries are very well done.  I was able to sample some of the 12 flavors of gellato that they make in house and out of the three I tried the bananas foster was my favorite, excellent flavors.  

I cannot wait to go back here for some gelato and some espresso  while sitting on their outdoor patio area.  Welcome to the neighborhood.

Space is limited. The tables are a tight fit inside. Their space behind the counter is larger than the eating area. All the tables are very wobbly and ruined my eating experience because I couldn't touch the table in fear of spilling my coffee. There wasn't anything special about the food either. I had an omelet.

A new place in north Vegas.

We stopped in for lunch, and we had the burger, as well as the four later sandwich. Both were tasty and juicy. The onion rings were perfection. Just the right amount of crispness. The potato salad was also surprising, you could definitely taste the freshness of it.

The desserts here were out of this world. The macaroons were very good, just the right level of crisp outside and slightly chewy insides. The cheesecake was also great.

What knocks it to give stars is that the woman behind the counter was so nice and helpful. The pastry chef even came out to talk to us, and it's that kind of staffing that makes a pleasant dining experience go from good to great.

Good food. Poor service.  
The staff was doing all they could to serve customers, but there was only one cook and one cashier that was also the server.
They need to hire people
Outstanding service, the food was amazing, great presentation and the cook paid a visit to make sure we were happy with our meal. Wish I lived closer, this would be a regular spot.

I have been in twice now for coffee and pastry. Their coffee is delicious, smooth and they keep your cup filled! We had a dessert the first time, the chef went over the selections himself and it was chocolaty and gorgeous to look at. The second time we had the pastries, croissant and one filled with a coffee cream. Both were warm from the oven, flaky and just lovely. I can't wait to try the food!
I love the food and staff is very nice. Overall, it's cozy with a nice patio and the menu item are more unique than a typical breakfast diner. It's more like an European cafe.

Well to be honest, folks are friendly. Food is mediocre at best. I am sure the bakery side of this business is far better. The service is mediocre on the food and service side. But the counter staff was better. 
A customer asked for sugar, for her drink which there was none on her table. The server when asked for some she pointed to the next table and said there is some, and walked away leaving the customer to put her sandwich down to get up and go over to the table to get it. Just not the way it should be done. 
The Pastry Chef dressed and seemed professional and friendly as well. 
Hope this helps

Looks inviting with all of the yummy treats.  However, they have one cook working and it took 45 minutes for a bowl of soup and a burger.  The food was greasy and not good.  More importantly, the staff was rude. We will not be returning and it's a shame because we need good lunch spots on this side of town.

We came here for breakfast, I had the croissant breakfast sandwich which was really good. It was served with a side of potatoes and it came out pretty quick. We didn't have any desserts but they all look wonderful

Furious. Ordered  a breakfast crepe for one son and a muffin for the other.  My son ordered a coke to go with his meal.  The ice is melted. It's a coke in a glass bottle that they pour in a glass. It's been 40 minutes since his order was placed.  Still no food. My other son got his muffin with his drink. He finished half an hour ago. I asked why it was taking so long. The lady told me you can see how busy the restaurant is. There are 18 or 19 people in here and the occupancy rating is 14 but there are seats left and seats open outside. It's Valentine's Day and a Sunday. Staff accordingly or close. It really isn't that hard. No one said it would take so long when I ordered. They aren't friendly. PLUS they have you tip when you order, which I wondered about but now I know why.

Wasn't too impressed with this place. 

Came in on a Saturday for brunch. It's a very small restaurant it has a "coffee shop" feel to it. There are delicious pastries on display and also ice cream. 

Breakfast is served all day although it does say breakfast ends at 11am on the menu but you can ask for the breakfast menu if you would like. I got a turkey bacon wrap. It was a wrap with maybe 2 pieces of turkey with lettuce, bacon, cheese and some Caesar dressing. There was a lot of cheese. The ratio just didn't fit. My beau got chicken curry. He said it was alright. I didn't try it. 

Our food took a lil while to come out although I do think it was the curry that probably took a while. Service was up to par. Food was not horrible but exceptions were slightly higher than what I got.

I stumbled upon this place when I was near the neighborhood and it was a perfect timing because I was craving for some French macarons. It's a really cute place with great service. The girl was so easy to talk to and her service was impeccable. I decided to eat here to try it out and since because I haven't ate yet. It's pretty much like a cafe. They have breakfast and lunch items, sandwiches and burgers, and soups and salads. On the dessert side they have cakes, pastries, gelato, and the French macarons. We ordered the honey 1/2 pound black angus sirloin burger and turkey pesto sandwich. Their food is pretty good. My only complaint about my food was that I wish there was more of that pesto spread so it had a little bit more flavor. But over all the food was delish. Oh, and their macarons are really yummy too AND cheap! So I'm definitely coming back here for more of that and to try the rest of their food.
Very friendly staff. I got the chocolate raspberry torte and wasn't too impressed by it. I'll def go back to try out the gelato and macaroons though. Overall, a good experience.
This place is a 5 star cafe the honey burger and ham n cheese quich is the bomb come check them out its great

Very nice restaurant for breakfast or lunch. Unfortunately they do run out of key ingredients but that's because they are small and strive for fresh product.  They're breakfast crepe always makes a stop worthwhile

I would love to say that I love this place but, the past couple of times we have been here they have been out of food and drink items, like all of the soft drinks, a few teas, onion rings, and coleslaw - all at the same time. I would like to believe that a restaurant would be a little more proactive in their stocked items and know ahead of time when they are out of more than one thing. Service is slow, but the servers are incredibly nice and the food is okay. I paid ~$30 for two lunches and I would have rather spent that amount (or less) somewhere else. I'm not sure we will be back... I wished it was better!

Hidden in a busy shopping center off of Decatur and 215 this place just didn't thrill me enough to want to go back. 
The inside is super tiny. I was the only one in there and it felt cramped. There is outside seating which was a tad better but it faces the parking lot and the cafe is next to a tutoring place so that meant hearing lots of kiddos running in and out while I was eating and breathing in their parents exhaust as they idled in the red parking zone. 
When I went in there was no one around except the chef in the back area. Once the waitress returned from her smoke break she took our order. Even though she washed her hands, wow the smell of smoke was very strong- I almost left at that point. 
Food was just ok. Nothing super great. 30$ for 2 sandwiches and sides was a bit steep for me.

Friendly, fast service, clean storefront and kitchen (I like that you can see into the kitchen!!), and a welcoming environment.  They had a great breakfast selection, but a chocolate cupcake caught my eye!! So rich and amazing and... their chef was amazed that I asked what kind of buttercream he used! It's not the shortening crap you get from some places!! Oh no!!! They make true Italian buttercream, and oh the difference!!! The flavor and mouth feel were perfect, the cake was still moist even though I feel the cupcake was made the day before.  The flavor was on point and not overwhelming or too sweet, and it was decorated beautifully! I will definitely return to sample more of their goods!!! I recommend this place to everyone! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because I reserve that for near perfection.  I am not taking anything at all away from this gem of a cafe- it just isn't a Michelin starred place :)  Go visit them!!!
Decent food and decent staff! I recently met a friend for brunch... Nice outdoor seating on good weather days!

Fabulous service. They come out to great you an to see if everything is ok. They make you feel at home. The food is always cooked fresh right in front of you. And the desserts are to die for. Overall it's a great atmosphere and a great place to have breakfast or lunch or even dinner it's up to you

Trying out this newly opened cafe.  They have a chicken curry that uses scotch bonnet peppers and allspice that looked interesting.  Also, a series of crepes and trying the shrimp Alfredo, Truffle and tomato salad, and baked Mac and cheese casserole.

Smells terrific!

I have had breakfast, lunch and dinner here. All 3 are phenomenal. Not only does the food taste and look first class but the personnel who work there are very nice and helpful. The deserts are a star as well. And not only look like they come from a 5 star resturaunt but taste like it too.  This could be a 5 star resturaunt in disguise!

I wish I could give this place a better review but I wasn't able to taste any of the food. We were there for 15 minutes before we were served our coffee,  then waited another 30 only to find out, that while other people continously kept getting served before us, our food was not even being prepped. We decided to leave.   

On a positive note,  the ambiance was great.  The food looked appetizing,  and even though we were forgotten the staff was apologetic and pleasant.  We were given two free muffins and hopefully my review will get better,  if we decide to go back.

This review is about my experience ordering a custom cake from the bakery. They boasted competitive prices and unique designs but unfortunately, my experience was awful. Anthony, the cake maker, is inexperienced. He asked me to email him the artwork for printing onto edible paper which I did, but he called me several times confused and just not savvy with email so therefore, communication was very frustrating. He couldn't see all the attachments, didn't understand how to get the photos I sent, etc. so weird! But that's not all - he and I sat together in person and he made several suggestions on the cake design. He convinced me to go with brown fondant and gold trim and to go with a full sheet instead of a half sheet so he could fit all the design elements on it nicely. I agreed. We even found a sample cake on Pinterest for him to follow. When I picked up the cake, it was out in the open in the drinks cooler uncovered and unwrapped meaning any one could touch it or sneeze on it. Why?! And the cake was white with turquoise trim. What happened to brown and gold? This was a military retirement cake that came out looking like a practice cake for baby shower instead because of the colors.  

There were huge creases in the fondant, the corners were folded over and he failed at his attempt to cover them up with frosting trim. Some parts of the cake had a glitter sheen, others didn't. He left half the cake blank with all the artwork in only 3 of 4 of the corners after convincing me to buy a larger cake for enough room to fit everything. The trim (turquoise! Ugh!) was slapped on there crooked and did not look professionally done at all. 

Now, I will say this - the cake itself was moist and the chocolate tasted good. The fondant was way too thick to eat though and the bad customer service, inexperienced baker, and poor workmanship still made the cake awful. I hated it and have never had this kind of experience after the many events I've hosted. Will not be back, will not be recommending his work, and will never get to give the cafe food a chance after this! 

Also, Anthony did not return my calls and conveniently had "stepped out" when I came to get the cake so he never did own up to how/why he deviated from the design and his poorly made cake. I appreciate the cashier who empathized with me when I expressed my disappointment. She, herself, said she was very embarrassed about the cake. She's not the only one who should be embarrassed!

I purchased a restaurant.com coupon for this place about 1 year ago.....finally made it over and they no longer accepted them. The staff apologized and offered a $5 discount for our inconvenience. We were excited to finally try the quaint restaurant and accepted their offer. 

The extremely polite staff and well plated food was only the start of our amazing experience. Our beverages stayed full the food was cooked to perfection. I highly recommend making a visit.

I'm so pleasantly surprised by this little gem! My husband ordered the curry chicken, my daughter ordered the seafood sandwich with salmon and shrimp, and I ordered the tomato truffle salad!! It was all amazing!!! The service was out of this world!! The chef came to check on is and ask us how everything was. My daughter tried to get the seasoning recipe for the fries and he had a great sense of humor about their secret recipe. We ended with gelato, rum raisin, pumpkin, and mango!!! We. Will. Be Back!

I don't review unless I've been to a place several times. Honey cakes is awesome! I love this place. The bananas foster crepes are amazing. Lattes are made with perfection. My husband loves the steak and eggs. The croissants are delicious. The potato leek soup is good. What can I say? I haven't tried anything I don't like.

Friendly employee behind the counter. Cute decor with a French ambiance even the music is nostalgic. A great addition to this area being that its neighboring dessert and breakfast places consist of self serve or fast food.

I had the chicken alfredo crepes, wife had the chicken curry and my son had chicken tenders.  All of it was delicious and the chicken was very tender and flavorful. We also had some of their wonderful pastries.  Sat outside and enjoyed the great weather. The staff was very friendly and the service was great. We will be coming back to this place quit often.

I ordered the meat lovers quiche. It was a little cold in the middle. The side of bacon that  I got was good, but It could have been fried a little more crispy. I also got coffee. The server never came to see if I would have liked more coffee, which was disappointing. I was the only person there, so how hard is it to check on your one customer (and I had tipped her in advance). Not the best customer service, and for the price of the unremarkable food and coffee that wasn't refilled, I doubt I will return.

I have been looking for a small local spot with good pastries for the occasional snack.  I was surprised to find Honey Cakes because I was expecting only a pastry store.  It turns out to be a great spot for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  I had the Honey Burger and a tomato salad.  Fantastic and very reasonable prices especially for the portions you get.  I finished with a pear/almond tart that was amazing.  Worth the stop, even if a bit out of the way.

Not so good experience, the order was wrong on 3 counts, charged for items we did not get. When the food arrived it was poorly made and little taste compared to what was described on the menu. 
There seem to be conflicts with the staff and lots of chaos behind the counter so waiting to get even a refill on a beverage was impossible.
I just stopped in minutes before they were gonna close and they were friendly and the desserts there were all so yummy looking I had to get one of each and man they are delicious

I came here from breakfast on a sunday. The food was great. To my surprise they came to our table to refill water and coffee just like a resturant. The service was great. I was so full from my breakfast I wasn't able to try any macaroons. So I went back today and I'm so glad I did. I've macaroons in France, these were the same if not better.There was more filling! Not to mention the woman behind the counter convinced me to buy the butterscotch muffin. I felt like a suckered buying into it until I just took my first bite. It's incredible! After eating it I wanted  make sure to tell everyone about it, so I yelped it. Enjoy!

My husband has found a new place for his favorite bacon breakfast Sandwhich! We practically own stock at Starbucks as he gets a couple or more breakfast sandwiches a week! Not any more! We are so happy we gave this cafe a shot! We would much prefer to solicit a small business. 

It's a great little cafe for breakfast! Terrific attentive and friendly service! We have made this our new weekend breakfast spot! I really like the French music they were playing and the last Sunday we were in they were playing Motown. Personally, the French music gives the place a quaint European feel. It is not a deal breaker though. Definitely looking forward to trying other dishes including the jerk chicken.
I love this restaurant. ..The employees are very nice & the food was really appetizing. ..I love the  presentation. ..we will return. Great job!

Best French cuisine I've had in a long time! Maryann is so pleasant and the service is great! Perfect place to meet with friends or just have an impromptu breakfast date with the hubs. Can't wait to come back next week! 

The fruit tarts and crepes are incredible. Coffees are smooth and REAL! They even have gelato! Yes!! Lol

You only get one chance to make a first impression. I got a water coffee crepes and a egg quiche. My son got eggs and sausage links. Now let's start the list. Coffee never showed up, the crepes were suppose to show up before the meal they didn't, the quiche was soggy like it had been microwaved, my sons eggs had shells in them. The disappointing part is you pay in advance and you tip in advance. So many good reviews and I was excited, but too many bad things to ever go back. Still want to give it one more chance to try those croissants, they said they were fresh.

After doing some shopping in the same parking lot as Honey Cakes Cafe, I decided to stop by and pick up some lunch to-go. I noticed some tasty looking desserts in the front glass case, so I decided to pick out some of those along with my lunch order. I was greeted by the owner Anthony, who says he brings 20 years of experience working on the Strip here to his baby, Honey Cakes Cafe. He said that he experienced a few kinks after first opening, but feels he has things smoothed out now. 

The Corner Salad ($9.95) - Lettuce, tomatoes, red onions, bacon, avocado and jerk grilled chicken with jerk honey home dressing. The salad also had a couple large croutons on the top of the salad that I broke up and sprinkled over the top. The lettuce was crisp and the veggies were very fresh. I also enjoyed the dressing. The bacon had great flavor. When it came to the chicken I was disappointed. It just tasted like grilled chicken with salt and pepper which isn't bad, but nothing special. I hoped with "jerk" being in the name and seeing the pictures of the chicken they had on the menu, that it would have had more flavor. The salad was still very good and the portion was big. 

Potato Leek Soup ($5.50) - I really liked this soup and could have just eaten the soup and a piece of bread as a meal since it was a good portion. The soup held up well during the car ride and was still nice and when I had it after tackling my salad. 

Veggie Quiche - My order was taking longer than I expected. One employee stopped at the table I was sitting at and let me know it was taking some time because they were making it fresh. A moment later, Anthony brought me over a veggie quiche that he said just came out of the oven and wanted me to try it. I explained that I needed room for my salad and soup, but he insisted. I really enjoyed the quiche and would eat one again. I also enjoyed the genuine passion and pride that Anthony clearly has in the type of food he puts out. The smile on his face when I took the first bite of the quiche said it all. 

Butterscotch Muffin ($3.99) After all the food I consumed, I had forgotten about the few goodies I picked out. The butterscotch muffin was heated up and packaged nicely. I was impressed with how warm and fresh the muffin still was just like the soup. I could only eat half, but it was worth every penny. 

Chocolate Mousse Cake ($4.50) - I shared this with hubby later for desert and we both really liked it. The chocolate flavor tasted excellent! I think some people who like chocolate, but don't love it will want to try something else because the chocolate really stands out in this one which I personally like, but others might find too rich. 

When I first walked inside, I noticed how it wasn't too spacious, but more narrow. They have tables inside where you can eat, but it can get tight on space if it's busy. I'd recommend dining out on the more spacious patio if you aren't getting your food to-go. The tables outside are a decent size and the tables that are in direct sunlight have large umbrellas over them providing good shade. Even though the chicken was simple the salad was so fresh and tasted great, the soup was comforting and going to become my best friend in Fall, the baked goods tasted excellent and my to-go order was packaged well and still hot. I'd recommend calling your order in if you want your food to-go as it will help cut down on your wait time if you are on a timed lunch break.

I wandered into this cafe and found myself surprised! I had a vanilla and pistachio gelato cone. I didn't taste anything  artificial it was delicious. The cafe itself is charming as is the staff. The dessert was the first thing that caught my eye that I had no idea there was more this cafe offered! I will be coming here for lunch.

Great little cafe! Me and my husband were pleasantly surprised to see a place like this in North Las Vegas. There's outdoor seating with umbrellas and indoor seating if you need to get out of the sun.
I had the breakfast sandwich which was delicious. My husband had the steak and eggs which he said was "ok". We also had the tiramisu which I thought was amazing!! It even came in a little edible chocolate cup.
We will definitely be back if not for breakfast at least for another pastry.
Cute cafe with good food & friendly staff. Only wish the Internet has been working so we could have gotten some work done while relaxing there.

This place is nothing but a joke, whoever envisioned this restaurant to become a successful story needs to re-evaluate their product, their management, and the voice and opinions of their clients! Disappointing customer service, tasteless food, and their staff in the kitchen?? How desperate are you guys?? To hire people without experience, without passion without hard core values? Las Vegas is known for amazing eateries, this place runs solely on that 1 cashier, who tries her best, and sympathizes with customers when they are upset. This cashier takes the beatings while the rest of the staff hides out!
Excellent service and the food is exceptional.  Wonderful array of teas,  pastries,  and  a eclectic menu.... Thank you Jordan for your hospitality

I'm 5 starring for excellent service and fantastic food. Was at the Teton Trails Park for lacrosse games and was clueless where to head to in this area for decent food beyond fast food. This was a wonderful surprise. 

Perused the electronic menu boards. Decided on the breakfast crepe stuffed with eggs, sausage, ham, bacon and topped with  American cheese and ordered at the cashier. While American isn't my favorite it worked well with the breakfast crepe. They'd probably substitute for one of the other cheeses. It was perfect when it was brought to my table. 

Got carry out of a turkey and bacon wrap and will try to remember to update further once it's been sampled. : )
Amazing, Amazing food. I had the seafood burger and it was outstanding. It's kind of a hidden gym in the north, but I can't say enough about the quality of the food.

Wow. I have never been so disappointed in my life. The 2 girls at the register were very nice and gracious. First of all, the 3 items that I was interested in they did not have available.
